posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: June 7, 2018 at 11:54 PM#2use the wildcard * to build a selection syntax that represents any fixture that is a .1 subfixture:CodeFixture *.1then apply this selection-syntax via the If keyword, to intersect, rather than expand current selection:CodeIf Fixture *.1

posts.post_text: July 23, 2018 at 5:39 PM#3What about creating a group for the .1-fixtures?Or use the MAtricks with the right Interleave and first fixture.In your case, the Mac Aura has 2 or three instances? For 2 instances just select all Mac Aura and then the even-MAtricks.For three instances select all Mac Aura and then the "1 of 3"-MAtricks to select only the first subfixtures.Gralf
